content.question: Based on the map above, which of the following is the most accurate statement about the 1948 presidential election?

choices.label: Republicans had great success in California and the Pacific Northwest.
The Democratic Party derived the majority of its support from the solid South in the 1948 election.
The Republican Party had ended its long streak of electoral failures in the former Confederate states by 1948.
Support for the Republican Party was concentrated in the Southwest and Rocky Mountain states.
The New Deal coalition that had elected Franklin D. Roosevelt four times had begun to weaken by 1948.

content.answer: The New Deal coalition that had elected Franklin D. Roosevelt four times had begun to weaken by 1948.

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
